qas.question: How many named lakes are there in Montana?
What is the name of the largest freshwater lake in western United States?
What is the name of the largest reservoir in the state?
What river is the Fort Peck Reservoir on?

context: There are <a0_0>at least 3,223<a0_0/> named lakes and reservoirs in Montana, including <a1_0>Flathead Lake<a1_0/>, the largest natural freshwater lake in the western United States. Other major lakes include Whitefish Lake in the Flathead Valley and Lake McDonald and St. Mary Lake in Glacier National Park. The largest reservoir in the state is <a2_0>Fort Peck Reservoir<a2_0/> on the <a3_0>Missouri river<a3_0/>, which is contained by the second largest earthen dam and largest hydraulically filled dam in the world. Other major reservoirs include Hungry Horse on the Flathead River; Lake Koocanusa on the Kootenai River; Lake Elwell on the Marias River; Clark Canyon on the Beaverhead River; Yellowtail on the Bighorn River, Canyon Ferry, Hauser, Holter, Rainbow; and Black Eagle on the Missouri River.
